topicmeta.shortdesc: Duo Security (multi-factor authentication) is required at UMN Sign-In pages. The Sign-In page is the University's gateway to applications such as my, G Suite (Gmail, Calender, Docs, etc.) Canvas, and many others.
Duo provides many different options to verify your identity. If you have questions or concerns about using Duo, contact your disability Resource Center.
Activate Duo Authentication for your account. Once activated Duo cannot be opted out of.
Adding and removing devices from Duo can be done at any time.
You can add a new device to your account via self-service at any time.
Remove devices from Duo Authentication. Removing devices will not remove Duo from your account.
Reactivate a device that was once in use.
Duo security is recommended for smart phones and tablets- additional information on compatibility is provided by the table below.

concept.title: What is Multi-Factor Authentication?
concept.shortdesc: Duo Security (multi-factor authentication) is required at UMN Sign-In pages. The Sign-In page is the University's gateway to applications such as my, G Suite (Gmail, Calender, Docs, etc.) Canvas, and many others.

conbody.p: By requiring you to verify your identity with a device, Duo adds another layer of security in front of the information, accounts, and assets you access online (even in the event your password is stolen). Once enrolled, you will be able to deny access to your accounts (on your Duo-enrolled device) if someone else is trying to sign in as you.

concept.title: Accessibility Options
concept.shortdesc: Duo provides many different options to verify your identity. If you have questions or concerns about using Duo, contact your disability Resource Center.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: How to Enable Duo Authentication
task.shortdesc: Activate Duo Authentication for your account. Once activated Duo cannot be opted out of.

taskbody.context: Enabling Duo as a first time user

step.cmd: Sign into my-account.umn.edu with your UMN Internet ID and password.
Select Duo Security from the navigation menu on the left-hand side of the page.

substep.cmd: In the drop-down menu, choose Enable Duo Security

step.cmd: Select Yes to opt in, then select Submit.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
concept.title: Managing Your Duo Devices
concept.shortdesc: Adding and removing devices from Duo can be done at any time.

conbody.p: It is strongly suggested to have at least two different devices added to your Duo Security account. By doing so, you will still be able to access your Duo account using your secondary device even if your primary Duo device is broken or inaccessible.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Adding a Device to Duo
task.shortdesc: You can add a new device to your account via self-service at any time.

taskbody.context: To add a new Duo device:

step.cmd: Sign into my-account.umn.edu with your UMN Internet ID and password
Authenticate with Duo using your backup device or a bypass code

substep.cmd: If you have a new device that uses the same phone number as an existing Duo device on your account, use the Call Me option
If you do not have a backup device or bypass codes AND your new device has a different phone number, prepare a valid form of photo ID and contact Technology Help for assistance

step.cmd: Select Duo Security from the navigation menu
Select Create or Manage Duo Account

substep.cmd: Authenticate with Duo a second time using one of the options from step 2

step.cmd: Select Add another device
Select the type of device you wish to add

substep.cmd: If you wish to enroll a smart phone tied to an international (non-US) phone number, add the device as a Tablet rather than a Mobile phone

step.cmd: Click Continue and follow the prompts to complete enrollment for your device
If you are adding a smart phone or a tablet, you will be prompted to scan a QR code or use an activation link to activate Duo mobile

substep.cmd: Scan the QR code and click Continue to complete the enrollment process

If the QR code was created on the same device that you are trying to enroll, select Email me an activation link instead. Enter an email address that you can check on the device you wish to enroll. Click Send email

step.cmd: Use the device you are trying to enroll to open the emailed link. On the Activate Duo Mobile by Email screen, select Continue to complete the enrollment process.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Removing a Device From Duo
task.shortdesc: Remove devices from Duo Authentication. Removing devices will not remove Duo from your account.

taskbody.context: To remove a device from duo:

step.cmd: Sign into my-account.umn.edu with your UMN Internet ID and password
Authenticate with Duo using an existing device or with a bypass code

substep.cmd: If you do not have an existing device or bypass codes, prepare a valid form of photo ID and contact Technology Help for assistance

step.cmd: Select Duo Security from the navigation menu
Select Create or Manage Duo Account

substep.cmd: Authenticate with Duo a second time using one of the options from step 2

step.cmd: Select Device Options for the device you want to remove
Click the trash can icon
Click Remove

task.domains: (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Reactivate an Existing Device
task.shortdesc: Reactivate a device that was once in use.

step.cmd: Sign into my-account.umn.edu with your UMN Internet ID and password
Authenticate with Duo using your backup device or a bypass code

substep.cmd: If you have a new device that uses the same phone number as an existing Duo device on your account, use the Call Me option
If you do not have a backup device or bypass codes AND your new device has a different phone number, prepare a valid form of photo ID and contact Technology Help for assistance

step.cmd: Select Duo Security from the navigation menu
Select Create or Manage Duo Account

substep.cmd: Authenticate with Duo a second time using one of the options from step 2

step.cmd: Next to the device you are reactivating or replacing, select Device Options
Select Reactivate Duo Mobile
If you are reactivating an existing phone number on your account, you will be prompted to verify ownership of the device

substep.cmd: Select Call me to get your verification code
Enter the 6-digit code and select Verify

step.cmd: You will be prompted to install Duo Mobile on your device. Once the Duo Mobile application is installed on your device, select I have Duo Mobile Installed
If you are adding a smart phone or a tablet, you will be prompted to scan a QR code or use an activation link to activate Duo mobile

substep.cmd: Scan the QR code and click Continue to complete the enrollment process

If the QR code was created on the same device that you are trying to enroll, select Email me an activation link instead. Enter an email address that you can check on the device you wish to enroll. Click Send email

step.cmd: Use the device you are trying to enroll to open the emailed link. On the Activate Duo Mobile by Email screen, select Continue to complete the enrollment process.

reference.shortdesc: Duo security is recommended for smart phones and tablets- additional information on compatibility is provided by the table below.
